name: European Pharmaceutical Students' Association
goal:
The European Pharmaceutical Students' Association is an independent, peaceful, democratic, non-political, non-religious, non-profit European organisation committed to the interests of pharmaceutical students, youth and recent graduates, representing over 100,000 pharmaceutical students.
Some areas in which the Association is profoundly active include the following:
• Development of campaigns/projects to increase the mobility of European pharmaceutical students particularly for periods of academic education, obligatory practical experience or scientific research.
• Raise awareness about the pharmaceutical profession and role of the pharmacist within society and in the Health Care team through campaigns, projects, policies of Association.
• Enabling students to experience cultural differences, share their opinion and have European perspectives
• Building mutual understanding and cooperation between youth from different European countries and different European cultures
• Giving a chance to youth with fewer opportunities (EPSA Support Fund)
interests: Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
To communicate with decision-makers and stakeholders the development and activities developed by EPSA during the past year. To communicate with Members of the European Parliament supporting the Association on its European initiatives regarding the healthcare, pharmacy, education, and youth initiatives, including the organisation of EPSA Annual Reception at the European Parliament.

Areas of interest:
- health policy
- pharmacy-related issues
- education-related issues
- youth-related issues

Main EU initiatives monitored:
- DIRECTIVE 2011/24/EU OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL of 9 March 2011 on the application of patients’ rights in cross-border healthcare
- DIRECTIVE 2005/36/EC OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL of 7 September 2005 on the recognition of professional qualifications
- DIRECTIVE 2013/55/EU OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL of 20 November 2013 amending Directive 2005/36/EC on the recognition of professional qualifications and Regulation (EU) No 1024/2012 on administrative cooperation through the Internal Market Information System (‘the IMI Regulation’)
- REGULATION OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL establishing 'Erasmus': the Union programme for education, training, youth and sport and repealing Regulation (EU) No 1288/2013

Participation in the Commission Open Public Consultation on strengthened cooperation against
vaccine preventable diseases (launched in December 2017)
